intro: Hibbertia ovata var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its broad, oval-shaped leaves and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Hibbertia ovata var. obovata is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
